comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1.klick Window->Preferences
2.Expand PHP
3.klick on PHP Executables
=> generates an error box (title "Could Not Accept Changes") with message "The currently displayed page contains invalid values.". the page then is more or less emty.


More information:
since I can't see what's configured as php executable(s) I don't know what exactly is used to run php scripts. Thus i can reproduces the problems from bug 204128 (if I run any php file I get no output and no error).
I'm working on Ubuntu 7.04. I downloaded a new "Eclipse Clasic" and the PDT through the pdt update site.
The error also occures if I download the all-in-one bundle form Zend (http://downloads.zend.com/pdt/all-in-one/pdt-1.0.0.R20070917-debugger-5.2.10.v20070905-all-in-one-linux-gtk.tar.gz).

The same problem on Windows Platform.
Also an exception is thrown as you open the debug preferences. It appears in the error log.

Created an attachment (id=79271)
Error logfile

Here is a logfile.

And increase the priority, please.

Hey Lukas,

I solved it with a workaround, so you can get it back working:

1.) Shutdown Eclipse
2.) Go to your workspace's folder and go to .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime/.settings
3.) Delete the file org.eclipse.php.debug.core.prefs
4.) Restart Eclipse and redefine your PHP Executables and Debug settings.


I think this problem occurs if you have preferences in your workspace that have been done by a version prior to 1.0 final.

We had a bug in the PHP executables registration.
This should be fixed in the next build.
Please retest.
this is fixed at latest build
